alert.note: Alert for Stewart; Webster (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 10 at 6:32PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Stewart and western Webster Counties through 700 PM EDT... At 632 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was near Kimbrough, or near Lumpkin, moving north at 30 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Lumpkin, Richland, Weston, Seminole, Troutman, Kimbrough, Westville and Brooklyn. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
